text:
For anything undocumented, I usually just create it in the design manager, then fetch it via CLI and I usually find my answer. Obviously, that is not up to par… but it gets the job done in the mean time

Edit: what <@U25PYL3Q8> said above (it helps if I read the whole thread lol)

Note: you’ll have to give the controlling field an id key
```"id": "your_unique_id"```

<@U3T21PDBK> This is for the main fields.json file that determines the ‘theme settings’. I created the fields by uploading my local json file using the watch command. I then did a fetch in another directory to get another copy of the entire project, and the fields.json file does not have any Ids in it. Thoughts?
did it originally have the ids?
I feel like I am missing something small. I created the fields.json locally. It synced up, and no IDs were generated. If they were generated, I do not know how to access them
when I created fields using json for a module, I was able to pull it down and it was for sure using IDs. The main fields.json fields seem different somehow
